standard_metadata.standard_description: Understand that patterns of association can also be seen in bivariate categorical data by displaying frequencies and relative frequencies in a two-way table. Construct and interpret a two-way table summarizing data on two categorical variables collected from the same subjects. Use relative frequencies calculated for rows or columns to describe possible association between the two variables.

question.content: The two-way frequency table below shows data on playing a sport and playing a musical instrument for students in a class.  **Complete the following two-way table of row relative frequencies.**    (If necessary, round your answers to the nearest hundredth.)   | Plays sports | Does not play sports - | :-: | :-: | :-: **Plays a musical instrument**  | $6$| $7$ **Does not play a musical instrument** | $8$ | $3$      | Plays a sport | Does not play a sport | Row total - | :-: | :-: | :-: **Plays a musical instrument**  | |  | $1.00$ **Does not play a musical instrument** |  |  | $1.00$

hints.content: Frequency table with row totals:   | Plays sports | Does not play sports | Row total - | :-: | :-: | :-: **Plays a musical instrument**  | $6$| $7$ |  $\blue{13}$ **Does not play a musical instrument** | $8$ | $3$ | $\pink{11}$

**Two-way table of row relative frequencies:**   | Plays sports | Does not play sports | Row total - | :-: | :-: | :-: **Plays a musical instrument**  | $\dfrac{6}{\blue{13}} \approx 0.46$| $\dfrac{7}{\blue{13}} \approx 0.54$ |  $\dfrac{\blue{13}}{\blue{13}} = 1.00$ **Does not play a musical instrument** | $\dfrac{8}{\pink{11}} \approx 0.73$ | $\dfrac{3}{\pink{11}} \approx 0.27$ | $\dfrac{\pink{11}}{\pink{11}} = 1.00$

question.content: The two-way frequency table below shows data on years working with the company and college degree status for Tom's coworkers.  **Complete the following two-way table of row relative frequencies.**    (If necessary, round your answers to the nearest hundredth.)   | At company less than $2$ years | At company $2$ or more years  - | :-: | :-: | :-: **College degree**  | $5$| $14$ **No college degree** | $16$ | $7$    | At company less than $2$ years | At company $2$ or more years| Row total - | :-: | :-: | :-: **College degree**  | |  | $1.00$ **No college degree** |  |  | $1.00$

hints.content: Frequency table with row totals:   | At company less than $2$ years | At company $2$ or more years| Row total - | :-: | :-: | :-: **College degree**  | $5$| $14$|  $\blue{19}$ **No college degree** | $16$ | $7$ | $\pink{23}$

**Two-way table of row relative frequencies:**   | At company less than $2$ years | At company $2$ or more years| Row total - | :-: | :-: | :-: **College degree**  | $\dfrac{5}{\blue{19}}\approx 0.26$| $\dfrac{14}{\blue{19}}\approx 0.74$ |  $\dfrac{\blue{19}}{\blue{19}} = 1.00$ **No college degree** | $\dfrac{16}{\pink{23}}\approx 0.70$ | $\dfrac{7}{\pink{23}}\approx 0.30$ | $\dfrac{\pink{23}}{\pink{23}} = 1.00$

question.content: The two-way frequency table below shows data on quidditch goals blocked when a goaltender was using a luck potion or a placebo.  **Complete the following two-way table of row relative frequencies.**    (If necessary, round your answers to the nearest hundredth.)   | Placebo | Luck potion - | :-: | :-: | :-: **Blocked the goal**  | $30$| $23$ **Did not block the goal** | $8$ | $5$    | Placebo | Luck potion | Row total - | :-: | :-: | :-: **Blocked the goal**  | |  | $1.00$ **Did not block the goal** |  |  | $1.00$

hints.content: Frequency table with row totals:   | Placebo | Luck potion | Row total - | :-: | :-: | :-: **Blocked the goal**  | $30$| $23$ | $\blueD{53}$ **Did not block the goal** | $8$ | $5$ | $\maroonD{13}$

**Two-way table of row relative frequencies:**   | Placebo | Luck potion | Row total - | :-: | :-: | :-: **Blocked the goal**  | $\dfrac{30}{\blueD{53}}\approx 0.57$| $\dfrac{23}{\blueD{53}}\approx 0.43$ | $\dfrac{\blueD{53}}{\blueD{53}}=1.00$ **Did not block the goal** | $\dfrac{8}{\maroonD{13}}\approx 0.62$ | $\dfrac{5}{\maroonD{13}}\approx 0.38$ | $\dfrac{\maroonD{13}}{\maroonD{13}} = 1.00$

question.content: Kamden is a mind-reading alien. He had each friend draw and look at a card, then he guessed whether the card had a star on it.  The two-way frequency table below shows data on guess and true status of the cards the friends drew.  **Complete the following two-way table of row relative frequencies.**    (If necessary, round your answers to the nearest hundredth.)   | Kamden guessed a star | Kamden guessed not a star - | :-: | :-: | :-: **Card had a star**  | $4$| $2$ **Card didn't have a star** | $1$ | $752$    | Kamden guessed a star | Kamden guessed not a star | Row total - | :-: | :-: | :-: **Card had a star** | |  | $1.00$ **Card didn't have a star** |  |  | $1.00$

hints.content: Frequency table with row totals:   | Kamden guessed a star | Kamden guessed not a star | Row total - | :-: | :-: | :-: **Card had a star**  | $4$| $2$|  $\blue{6}$ **Card didn't have a star** | $1$ | $752$  | $\pink{753}$

**Two-way table of row relative frequencies:**   | Kamden guessed a star | Kamden guessed not a star | Row total - | :-: | :-: | :-: **Card had a star**  | $\dfrac{4}{\blue{6}}\approx 0.67$| $\dfrac{2}{\blue{6}}\approx 0.33$ |  $\dfrac{\blue{6}}{\blue{6}} = 1.00$ **Card didn't have a star** | $\dfrac{1}{\pink{753}}\approx 0.00$ | $\dfrac{752}{\pink{753}}\approx 1.00$ | $\dfrac{\pink{753}}{\pink{753}} = 1.00$

**Two-way table of row relative frequencies:**   | Twins in family history | Twins not in family history | Row total - | :-: | :-: | :-: **Twins born**  | $\dfrac{8}{\blueD{34}} \approx 0.24$| $\dfrac{26}{\blueD{34}} \approx 0.76$ | $\dfrac{\blueD{34}}{\blueD{34}} = 1.00$ **Single child born** | $\dfrac{125}{\maroonD{966}} \approx 0.13$ | $\dfrac{841}{\maroonD{966}} \approx 0.87$ | $\dfrac{\maroonD{966}}{\maroonD{966}} = 1.00$

question.content: The two-way frequency table below shows data on whether medicine was taken and cold length for participants in a study conducted by The Cold Be Gone Company.   **Complete the following two-way table of column relative frequencies.**    (If necessary, round your answers to the nearest hundredth.)   | Medicine taken | Medicine not taken - | :-: | :-: | :-: **Cold length $7$ days or longer**  | $6$| $27$ **Cold length less than $7$ days** | $19$ | $12$      | Medicine taken | Medicine not taken  - | :-: | :-: | :-: **Cold length $7$ days or longer**  | |   **Cold length less than $7$ days** |  |   **Column total**| $1.00$| $1.00$

hints.content: Frequency table with column totals:    | Medicine taken | Medicine not taken  - | :-: | :-: | :-: **Cold length $7$ days or longer**  | $6$| $27$ **Cold length less than $7$ days** | $19$ | $12$ **Column total**|$\blue{25}$|$\pink{39}$

**Two-way table of column relative frequencies:**   | Medicine taken | Medicine not taken - | :-: | :-: | :-: **Cold length $7$ days or longer**  | $\dfrac{6}{\blue{25}}= 0.24$| $\dfrac{27}{\pink{39}}\approx 0.69$  **Cold length less than $7$ days** | $\dfrac{19}{\blue{25}}= 0.76$ | $\dfrac{12}{\pink{39}}\approx 0.31$ **Column total**|$\dfrac{\blue{25}}{\blue{25}} = 1.00$|$\dfrac{\pink{39}}{\pink{39}} = 1.00$

question.content: The two-way frequency table below shows data on whether Karissa had an ice cream cone and whether the day was during the week or on the weekend.  **Complete the following two-way table of column relative frequencies.**    (If necessary, round your answers to the nearest hundredth.)   | Weekday | Weekend - | :-: | :-: | :-: **Had an ice cream cone**  | $23$| $45$ **Did not have an ice cream cone** | $155$ | $6$     | Weekday | Weekend - | :-: | :-: | :-: **Had an ice cream cone**| |   **Did not have an ice cream cone** |  |   **Column total**|$1.00$|$1.00$

hints.content: Frequency table with column totals:   | Weekday | Weekend - | :-: | :-: | :-: **Had an ice cream cone**  | $23$| $45$ **Did not have an ice cream cone** | $155$ | $6$ **Column total**|$\blue{178}$|$\pink{51}$

**Two-way table of column relative frequencies:**   | Weekday | Weekend - | :-: | :-: | :-: **Had an ice cream cone**   | $\dfrac{23}{\blue{178}}\approx0.13$| $\dfrac{45}{\pink{51}}\approx 0.88$ **Did not have an ice cream cone** | $\dfrac{155}{\blue{178}}\approx 0.87$ | $\dfrac{6}{\pink{51}}\approx 0.12$  **Column total**|$\dfrac{\blue{178}}{\blue{178}} = 1.00$|$\dfrac{\pink{51}}{\pink{51}} = 1.00$
